title: Knotted Lemon Cookies
source: The Food of Sicily - Fabrizia Lanza
categories: The Food of Sicily - Fabrizia Lanza
ingredients: - 4 cups (480 g) all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
- 1½ tablespoons powdered ammonium carbonate (baker’s ammonia or hartshorn)
- ⅔ cup (160 ml) whole milk, lukewarm
directions: 1. In a bowl, whisk together the flour and granulated sugar.2. Work in the lard, ammonium carbonate, lemon zest, and salt with your hands.3. Make a well in the center and add the eggs, then gradually work in the milk, mixing by hand until a very soft dough forms (you may not need all the milk).4. Knead the dough vigorously until it pulls off your fingers easily but is still sticky.5. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.6. On a lightly floured surface, roll a piece of dough into a rope ½ inch (1.25 cm) thick.7. Cut the rope into 5-inch (12.5 cm) lengths. Form a loop and pass one end through the center to create a knot.8. Place knots on the prepared baking sheets. Repeat with remaining dough.9. Bake until golden brown, about 20 minutes.10. While the cookies bake, mix the powdered sugar with enough lemon juice to make a thin icing.11. Dip the top of each warm cookie into the icing and place on a rack to cool.12. Sprinkle with orange zest if desired.
